metadata.purpose: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance checklist and accessibility standards

perceivable.principle: Information and user interface components must be presentable to users in ways they can perceive

textAlternatives.guideline: 1.1 - Provide text alternatives for any non-text content

successCriteria.description: All non-text content has text alternative
checkpoints: Decorative images have empty alt attributes
Charts and graphs have text summaries

successCriteria.description: Alternatives for audio-only and video-only content
checkpoints: Video content has audio descriptions or transcripts

successCriteria.description: Captions for all prerecorded audio in synchronized media
checkpoints: Sound effects are described in captions

adaptable.guideline: 1.3 - Create content that can be presented in different ways without losing information or structure

successCriteria.description: Information, structure, and relationships can be programmatically determined
checkpoints: Lists use proper markup (ul, ol, dl)
Tables have proper headers and captions
Form labels are associated with inputs
Semantic HTML elements are used correctly

successCriteria.description: Content order makes sense when presented sequentially
checkpoints: CSS positioning doesn't break content flow

successCriteria.description: Instructions don't rely solely on sensory characteristics
checkpoints: Instructions don't rely only on shape, size, or position
Color is not the only way to convey information

distinguishable.guideline: 1.4 - Make it easier for users to see and hear content

successCriteria.description: Color is not the only means of conveying information
checkpoints: Form validation doesn't rely only on color
Charts use patterns in addition to color

successCriteria.description: Text has sufficient contrast ratio
Text can be resized up to 200% without loss of functionality

operable.principle: User interface components and navigation must be operable

keyboardAccessible.guideline: 2.1 - Make all functionality available from a keyboard

successCriteria.description: All functionality is available via keyboard
checkpoints: All interactive elements are keyboard accessible

successCriteria.description: Keyboard focus is not trapped
checkpoints: Users can navigate away from any component
Modal dialogs have proper focus management

enoughTime.guideline: 2.2 - Provide users enough time to read and use content

successCriteria.description: Time limits can be turned off, adjusted, or extended
Moving, blinking, or auto-updating content can be controlled

seizuresPhysicalReactions.guideline: 2.3 - Do not design content that causes seizures or physical reactions

successCriteria.description: Content doesn't flash more than three times per second
checkpoints: No content flashes more than 3 times per second
Flashing content is below general flash threshold

navigable.guideline: 2.4 - Provide ways to help users navigate, find content, and determine where they are

successCriteria.description: Skip links are available to bypass repeated content
checkpoints: Skip to main content link exists
Skip links are visible when focused

successCriteria.description: Pages have descriptive titles
checkpoints: All pages have unique, descriptive titles
Titles describe page purpose or content

successCriteria.description: Focus order is logical and intuitive
checkpoints: Hidden content is not in tab order

understandable.principle: Information and the operation of user interface must be understandable

readable.guideline: 3.1 - Make text content readable and understandable

successCriteria.description: Primary language of page is programmatically determined

predictable.guideline: 3.2 - Make web pages appear and operate in predictable ways

successCriteria.description: Focus doesn't trigger unexpected context changes
checkpoints: Focus doesn't change page content unexpectedly

successCriteria.description: Input doesn't trigger unexpected context changes

inputAssistance.guideline: 3.3 - Help users avoid and correct mistakes

successCriteria.description: Input errors are identified and described
checkpoints: Form validation errors are clearly identified

successCriteria.description: Labels and instructions are provided for user input

robust.principle: Content must be robust enough to be interpreted reliably by a wide variety of user agents

compatible.guideline: 4.1 - Maximize compatibility with current and future assistive technologies

successCriteria.description: Markup is valid and well-formed
checkpoints: Elements have complete start and end tags

successCriteria.description: UI components have accessible names, roles, and values
checkpoints: Custom controls have proper ARIA labels
